description:
Don't you just hate these apps that try to replace a web page?
Everyone is doing it these days.
We tried to have a unified interface for the internet and callerd it the World Wide Web and had a browser that could see most pages on this web.
Now, everyone wants do ditch that interface and go back to using separate apps to do their bidding. What's the point? Most of the apps are severely lacking compared to their web equivalent (ebay, amazon, twitter, faceboak etc.) so why ditch the web page in favour of less functionality and more storage space needs on your device? It beats me. (Even windoze 11 has reduced functionality compared to windoze 10 - they want more control over what we can see ;-)

I think that 3 stars is generous for this app since it actually does provice all the channels provided but it's a pain to get at. You must open a teminal and type a command or setup a desktop shortcut somehow, which the installation procedure should really do for you, in order to load the program into memory and run it - quite old-fashioned. It also doesn't show the history of the playlist on the current channel, which the web page does.

Oh well, life goes on ...
summary: Poor replacement for the web page
